New Records: San Diego Padres became the first team in MLB history to clinch a postseason spot with a game-ending triple play.
Key Match Events: The Padres turned a game-ending triple play to secure a 4-2 victory over the Dodgers.
Manny Machado started the triple play by stepping on the bag and throwing to Jake Cronenworth at second, who then threw to Donovan Solano at first.
Shohei Ohtani was left in the on-deck circle as the game ended.
Post-Match Reflections: Padres manager Mike Shildt expressed that the game couldn't have been scripted any better.
Manny Machado reflected on the late owner Peter Seidler, saying 'He’s been with us all year.'
Rookie phenom Jackson Merrill emphasized the team's focus on winning the division title.
Mike Shildt highlighted the importance of getting into the playoffs to win it all.
Manny Machado commented on the team's camaraderie and resilience despite losing key players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres' victory reduced the Dodgers' lead in the NL West to two games, the lowest since mid-August.
The Padres have already secured the tiebreaker against the Dodgers.
The Padres celebrated their postseason clinch with champagne in the clubhouse and a team photo on the field.
The Padres have reached the postseason for the third time in five years and the eighth time in franchise history.
